intro: Lampranthus monticola, commonly known as the mountain lampranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun, making it well adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to red, bloom in late summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Lampranthus monticola is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and low maintenance requirements.
